009package imagingbook.common.filter.linear;
010
011import imagingbook.common.filter.generic.GenericFilter;
012import imagingbook.common.filter.generic.GenericFilterScalarSeparable;
013import imagingbook.common.image.PixelPack.PixelSlice;
014
015/**
016 * This class represents a 2D linear filter that is x/y-separable and specified by two 1D-kernels. It is based on
017 * {@link GenericFilter} and {@link GenericFilterScalarSeparable}, which take care of all data copying and filter
018 * mechanics. Since it is a "scalar" filter, pixel values are treated as scalars. If the processed image has more than
019 * one component (e.g., a RGB color image), this filter is automatically and independently applied to all
020 * (scalar-valued) components. To apply to an image, use the {@link #applyTo(ij.process.ImageProcessor)} method, for
021 * example.
022 */
023public class LinearFilterSeparable extends GenericFilterScalarSeparable {
024
025        private float[] hX = null;                      // the horizontal kernel array
026        private float[] hY = null;                      // the vertical kernel array
027        private int width = 0;                          // width of the effective kernel
028        private int height = 0;                         // height of the effective kernel
029        private int xc = 0;                                     // 'hot spot' x-position
030        private int yc = 0;                                     // 'hot spot' y-position
031        
032        /**
033         * Constructor, takes a 1D convolution kernel to be applied both
034         * in x- and y-direction. 
035         * 
036         * @param kernelXY a 1D convolution kernel
037         */
038        public LinearFilterSeparable(Kernel1D kernelXY) {
039                this(kernelXY, kernelXY);
040        }
041
042        /**
043         * Constructor, takes two 1D convolution kernels to be applied in x- and y-direction, respectively. One (but not
044         * both) of the supplied kernels may be {@code null}. If this is the case, filtering in the associated direction is
045         * skipped.
046         *
047         * @param kernelX a 1D kernel for convolution in x-direction
048         * @param kernelY a 1D kernel for convolution in y-direction
049         */
050        public LinearFilterSeparable(Kernel1D kernelX, Kernel1D kernelY) {
051                super();
052                
053                if (kernelX == null && kernelY == null) {
054                        throw new RuntimeException("both X/Y kernels may not be null");
055                }
056                
057                if (kernelX == null) {
058                        this.doX = false;       // skip X-part
059                }
060                else {
061                        this.hX = kernelX.getH();
062                        this.width = kernelX.getWidth();
063                        this.xc = kernelX.getXc();
064                }
065                
066                if (kernelY == null) {
067                        this.doY = false;       // skip Y-part
068                }
069                else {
070                        this.hY = kernelY.getH();
071                        this.height = kernelY.getWidth();
072                        this.yc = kernelY.getXc();
073                }
074        }
075
076        // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
077
078        // 1D convolution in x-direction
079        @Override
080        protected float doPixelX(PixelSlice source, int u, final int v) {
081                double sum = 0;
082                for (int i = 0; i < width; i++) {
083                        int ui = u + i - xc;
084                        sum = sum + source.getVal(ui, v) * hX[i];
085                }
086                return (float)sum;
087        }
088        
089        // 1D convolution in y-direction
090        @Override
091        protected float doPixelY(PixelSlice source, final int u, int v) {
092                double sum = 0;
093                for (int j = 0; j < height; j++) {
094                        int vj = v + j - yc;
095                        sum = sum + source.getVal(u, vj) * hY[j];
096                }
097                return (float)sum;
098        }
099
100}
